channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Political Gridlock Will Raise the Economic Stakes in France
item.description: The French election results point to a prolonged political logjam, which may not help a country bedeviled by high debt and slowing economic growth.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli General Condemns Rising ‘Nationalist Crime’ by Settlers
item.description: A departing Israeli military leader denounced Jewish settler violence in the occupied West Bank, in a swipe at the far right.

item.title: The highest-paying trade jobs in the U.S. include one paying over $100,000 per year—but you’ll have to be comfortable with tight spaces and heights
item.description: With AI threatening to steal corporate jobs and recent graduates finding themselves “unemployable”, trade jobs are becoming increasingly attractive—and lucrative.

item.title: Ukraine Looms Over NATO Summit, and Biden Is Defiant on Running
item.description: Plus, a potential new way to test for autism.

item.title: Modi Visits Putin’s Residence Outside Moscow
item.description: Russian state news media footage showed the two leaders hugging and petting horses during the first visit to Russia in five years by Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India.

item.title: How an ideological war over PrEP threatens preventive services from smoking cessation to contraception to vaccines for half the U.S. population
item.description: More than 150 million Americans now have access to preventive services—and these are popular across the political spectrum.

item.title: Where Is Beryl Heading Next? What to Know About the Deadly Storm
item.description: The storm hit Texas on Monday as a Category 1 hurricane. As the storm moved out of the state, officials warned it could take days to fully restore electricity.

item.title: Can This Doctor Tapped to Run Haiti Save the Country?
item.description: Haiti’s new prime minister is a trained gynecologist who experts say is more policy expert than seasoned politician. Many Haitians are counting on him to quell rampant gang violence.

item.title: Millennial law grad quit her director job in Monaco to launch a second-hand store with her mom—now she sells designer bags and bling at $3,200 a pop and treats her husband to Audemars Piguet
item.description: “Don’t take a job for the money. Take a job for what you can learn and for the passion,” says Sellier’s founder Hanushka Toni.

item.title: Kamala Harris Heads to Las Vegas, Focused on Biden-Trump Fight
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is set to speak in Las Vegas, aiming to focus on the stakes in President Biden’s fight against Donald J. Trump.

item.title: U.S. Officials Say Russia Is Unlikely to Take Much More Ukrainian Territory
item.description: Russian forces continue to inflict pain, but NATO leaders gathering in Washington can say that their efforts to strengthen Ukraine are working.

item.title: New Hollywood power player David Ellison outlines his ‘essential’ vision for Paramount to transition into a ‘tech hybrid’
item.description: That includes plans to “rebuild” the Paramount+ streaming service.

item.title: The Talented Democrats Who Aren’t Running for President
item.description: It’s getting harder to ignore the charismatic politicians who have been trying to support Biden.

item.title: Why Kenyan Police Officers Are Deployed in Haiti
item.description: About 400 Kenyan officers have deployed to Haiti as part of the first wave of a multinational contingent tasked with trying to restore order in the gang-plagued Caribbean nation.

item.title: The man dubbed ‘Britain’s Warren Buffett’ blames falling vet visits—not his refusal to back Nvidia—for poor performance of U.K.’s biggest fund
item.description: Smith's popular fund has again underperformed the benchmark, prompting him to defend his Nvidia stance once more.
